article.headline: Creighton 74, DePaul 62
article.story: OSKAR GARCIA Associated Press Writer OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- P'Allen Stinnett scored all of his game-high 23 points in the second half, giving Creighton a 74-62 win over DePaul in its season opener Friday night. Chad Millard added 15 points, 5 rebounds and 4 assists to send the Blue Demons their third straight season-opening loss. Dane Watts had 10 points and 9 rebounds. Stinnett held up his hands and shook his head as he banked home his last 3-pointer from the right wing, giving Creighton a 70-58 lead with little more than two minutes to play. Will Walker scored 13 points and Wesley Green added 10 for DePaul (0-1). Draelon Burns, expected to be the top option on offense for the Blue Demons, scored seven points on 3-of-16 shooting and failed to score in the second half. Burns missed all five of his 3-point attempts after rimming out a corner shot at the end of last season that would have sent the Blue Demons to the NIT semifinals. DePaul hit four of nine 3-point shots in the first half, but was 0-for-10 in the second half. Creighton recovered after missing 14 of its first 16 shots as the Blue Demons quickly built a 20-4 lead. The Bluejays cut DePaul's lead to four after a 13-point run, and tied the game at 32 when Josh Dotzler was left with a clear path in middle of the lane. The Blue Demons led 38-32 at the half. Creighton scored the first seven points of the second half, and Stinnett's layup gave the Bluejays their first lead of the game at 39-38. Stinnett hit all five of his 3-point shots in the second half after missing both attempts in the first.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
